page.title: 20CHILDREN'S ANSWERS:ST.ALBANS
page.content: Out of 100 children 19 were still 9 in June 1985. Out of 100 children 47 were born in St.Albans. Out of 100 children 45 had families greater than 4. Out of 100 children 38 had more than 1 car in their family. Out of 100 children 69 had pets. Out of 100 children 53 had a computer at home. Out of 100 children 87 had gas central heating. Out of 100 children most of them had between 50p-Â£1.00 pocket money per week. Only 16 had more than a Â£1.00 Out of 100 children only 13 watched more than 30 hours of television. Out of 100 children the most popular item of clothes with girls and boys was Jeans. Next with the girls was mini skirts and baggys with the boys.
